title.narrative: 07-01 - PRO-POOR SOCIAL BUDGETTING

description.narrative: End 2017, the Government has adopted a pro-poor programming and budgeting approach, gender sensitive and equitable at national level and a planning approach that puts boys and girls at the center of national development processes and reduces inequalities, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, economic and social policies and programs are result-focused, monitored, evaluated and disseminated and contribute to reducing disparities, vulnerability and child poverty and to the consolidation of peace.

participating-org.narrative: AGENCE DE PROMOTION DES INVESTISSEMENTS PRIVES APIP
MINISTERE DE L ADMINISTRATION DU TERRITOIRE ET DE LA DECENTRALISATION

mailing-address.narrative: Corniche Nord Immeuble Saadi Quartier Camayenne Conakry P. O. Box 222 - Conakry

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: End 2017, the Government has adopted a pro-poor programming and budgeting approach, gender sensitive and equitable at nationallevel and a planning approach that puts boys and girls at the center of national development processes and reduces inequalities

description.narrative: UNICEF provided continued support to the sectoral policy dialogue and advocacy in favor of the vulnerable and marginalized children and women. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of studies and surveys on child poverty integrating gender and human rights approaches carried out and disseminated

actual.value: 2015:The analysis on poverty built on MODA approach conducted in 2014 addressed key multidimensional deprivations faced by children and women in the country. Findings enhanced the programme to gain the signature by the Government and the Parliament of a document with 12 commitments in favor of children t

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning social accountability mechanisms
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Social protection system/programmes include emergency prevention, preparedness, and response
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Governemnt budget allocations to sectoral or child-focused policies and programs as percentage of total government budget allocations

target.value: 2017:23% (7% pour la Sante et 16% pour l'Education)

title.narrative: Number of National Plans and Programs Developed with Outcome Result, Human Rights, Gender and Equity

actual.value: 2015:Different Ministries have updated national policy and programme documents. Unicef has assured that documents are informed with updated evidences aiming to strengthen equity and gender in the sector of health, nutrition, wash, protection and education.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using monetary
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of Planning and monitoring systems that explicitly address risks at national and subnational level
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Humanitarian interventions inform the development or strengthening of social protection systems
National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
National policies and programmes are influenced by child poverty analysis and advocacy

target.value: 2017:PNDES and PNPS influenced by child poverty and advocacy

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Child poverty is explicitly included as part of a national developmen plan or similar, such as a standalone child poverty action plan
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) National budgetary frameworks that address child poverty and disparities
Existence of monitoring and evaluation mechanisms to follow up on social protection delivery/system
Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
Mechanisms of participation by the public and/or specifically adolesents or child rights advocates in national budget processes
